text:
Hi All!
Is there a way to debug if my Javascript integration is sending the .identify, .setPath and .pageView events? Currently it looks like it works, but only sometimes (I identify some visitors). I can’t understand is this tied to how HS ingests the data or the data even doesn’t get delivered. Theres an example of the code used in this post: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Triggered-JS-page-views-amp-identify-calls-do-not-display-in/m-p/685042#M56266>
I’ve been trying to resolve this for past week, so any help will be very welcome. :pray:

Hey <@U0409G46R7B> One thing you can do is look in the network tab for the tracking pixel to fire. Look for images called `_ptq.gif` on the `<http://track.HubSpot.com|track.HubSpot.com>` domain. That usually lets me track down conditions that are or are not firing
Should I see new contacts created in HS right away?
It should be relatively quick. If it’s not created within 5 minutes, something probably went wrong
yeah, so. just tested this.. _ptq.gif is firing
The cookie on your browser is fresh? If not I would expect it to update the exiting contact tied to that cookie

We are experiencing issues with a client site where the required js in the bottom of base.html won’t load on some pages, while other (and the HS backend) works like they always did.

Haven’t touched the project in weeks so can’t blame it on that, just stopped working more than half the time for some pages.

Doesn’t seem to be template specific either as one page built on page.html template will not load js and another will
Im running this in an incognito window
Plus I can’t find a single contact with the fresh email I’ve just used
I also run a server side integration and I already know that that one will create a contact when it runs (but the data between the JS/browser and the “offline” transaction will not be stitched).

using something like postman (or your serverside integration) can you see if there are any contacts associated with the cookie using <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_contact_by_utk|this endpoint >?
